channel.title: Nadjet's NLP Stuff
channel.description: Recent content on Nadjet's NLP Stuff

item.title: Sentence similarity with Bert vs SBert
item.description: We can compute the similarity between two sentences by calculating the similarity between their embeddings. A popular approach is to perform the mean or max averaging of the sentence word embeddings. Another approach, which is faster and more performant, is to use SBert models.

item.title: Projects for Data Science Master Students for Q1-2021
item.description: This first quarter of the 2020-2021 academic year, I supervise 6 final year projects in the Data Science Master of the UOC University, ranging from the development of a COVID-19 FAQ-based Q-A system to building knowledge graphs and performing end-to-end Natural Language Generation. Below is a list of resources and references I offer to get the students started organized in relevant topics.

item.title: Node similarity with graph embeddings using Node2Vec
item.description: I computed graph embeddings on Athletes in a graph modelling Olympic Games in Neo4j. I was then able to compute the most similar Athletes to any given Athlete using Node2Vec. I could then visually appreciate this similarity by looking at the corresponding subgraph subsuming the related nodes and their edges.

item.title: Uploading pre-existing datasets in Neo4j: lessons learnt
item.description: Recently I developed a proof-of-concept to model and query data with Neo4J starting from a pre-existing dataset. I also performed a training session for loading and querying a Neo4j graph database from a pre-existing “toy” dataset. Here is what I learnt from those exercises.

item.title: Anonymization
item.description: Anonymization What is anonymization? Anonymization means the processing of personal data in order to irreversibly prevent identification. If the personal information is recoverable, say because: it is held in a separate resource, or the information hiding techniques employed make it recoverable, or the data still contains information that makes the person identifiable or partially identifiable, or the different bits of information can be cross-referenced within the dataset or across different datasets to infer the identity of the person.

item.title: My projects for Data Science Master Students
item.description: Here are the projects I propose to Data Science Master students for their final project this semester. They range from text mining, concept mining, question answering to natural language generation. Most of them will be based on DBPedia/Wikipedia datasets.

item.title: Seq2seq Natural Language Generation
item.description: I implemented a seq2seq Natural Language Generator using the fastai library and the 2017 e2e NLG challenge dataset.

item.title: Mining and Geovisualization of Domain Specific DBPedia Concepts
item.description: I extracted domain specific concepts from DBPedia and showed them on an interactive map of the world. The geolocalization was done using Geonames. This was a fun project to do.

item.title: Setting up DBPedia/Geonames on OpenLink Virtuoso
item.description: In this post, I explain how to setup DBPedia and Geonames locally on Virtuoso Triplestore.

item.title: How to bulk upload data into Neo4j Community Edition
item.description: In this post, I explain how to upload concepts and relations into Neo4J Community Edition.

item.title: How to install DBPedia Spotlight Locally
item.description: In this post I explain how to install on DBPedia Spotlight on your local computer. DBPedia Spotlight is a tool that annotates mentions of DBPedia concepts in text. It is not in active development but can still be useful for Proof-of-Concept Demonstrators.

item.title: Multi-label classification
item.description: I have trained a classifier with fine tuned embedding language model that assigns content labels to basic restaurant descriptions using the fastai library.
